001package tictactoe;
002
003import java.util.*;
004
005/**
006 * A ComputerPlayer that generates random moves at available squares.
007 * 
008 * @author Tapio Malmberg
009 */
010public class RandomComputer implements ComputerPlayer {
011    /**
012     * Returns a random Coordinate of an available square on the game board.
013     * @param gameBoard the game board
014     * @param numInARowToWin not used by this algorithm
015     * @return a random Coordinate of an available square
016     */
017    @Override
018    public Coordinate getMove(ImmutableGameBoard gameBoard, int numInARowToWin) {
019        List<Coordinate> availableMoves = getAvailableMoves(gameBoard);
020        int randomIndex = Utils.getRandom(0, availableMoves.size() - 1);
021
022        return availableMoves.get(randomIndex);
023    }
024
025    /**
026     * Returns a list of all the empty squares on the game board.
027     * @param gameBoard the game board
028     * @return a List of Coordinates of empty squares on the game board
029     */
030    private List<Coordinate> getAvailableMoves(ImmutableGameBoard gameBoard) {
031        List<Coordinate> availableMoves = new ArrayList<Coordinate>();
032
033        for (int x = 0; x < gameBoard.getWidth(); x++) {
034            for (int y = 0; y < gameBoard.getHeight(); y++) {
035                if(gameBoard.getPosition(x, y) == TicTacToeGame.EMPTY)
036                    availableMoves.add(new Coordinate(x, y));
037            }
038        }
039
040        return availableMoves;
041    }
042}
